author: {'steamid': '76561198075438139', 'num_games_owned': 1133, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1670972909}
review:
So relaxing! I never thought I would be playing a game like solitaire in VR, but I did, and I liked it! 
Having to manually move the cards just feels good.  I definitely get back here when  I just want to chill out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046673938', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1622265168}
review: Pretty much meets expectations for a solitaire game. the only annoying thing is you cant directly pick up cards on one draw and instead have to let the animation play. something weird about this game is that it imply if you dont pay for premium you will gets ads(which would be kinda lame but its free so eh) but I never got a single ad in my hour playtime? this game is from four years ago so mabye the dev doesn't care about the finances anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003207640', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1534740734}
review: This is actually enjoyable. If you like VR and Solitaire, then i recommend this highly. They added some personality and humor to it while mimicing the experience of playing solitaire with physcial cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1528562050}
review:
Power Solitaire VR is a delightful version of the Klondike solitaire card game that introduces unique game play only possible in Virtual Reality. Play alone, against an intelligent robot, or live multiplayer with others online. It's a social VR game the whole family already knows how to play.  It worked on my system, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  

Try it, if you like solitaire.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yI0__F4N6o0

review: A really fun game to play if you enjoy Solitaire. You can play by yourself or with a group of friends. The only problem that I had was that when My wife and I were playing this game, we couldn't figure out how to disable the bot which kept joining the two of us. But other than that, it's a solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973622184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1518706339}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1505963439}
review:
Update: this game was made free to play.  It is a must download now. Thank you devs!  

Original review below -----------

This is exactly like Windows Solitaire, except with a few more options.  First of all, they have several different VR backgrounds and most of them are really well done.  So you get a nice scenic view.  There's 1 card draw or 3 card draw solitaire for solo play.  And there's Power Solitaire for multiplayer.  I didn't get to play power solitaire but the solo solitaire is exactly as I remember it, only in VR.  

I can't say the game is better than the Windows Solitaire, but it just feels better because it's in VR and you actually get to use your motion controller to move cards around so it just feels more immersive.  My only complaint is that the in-game music could have more variety.  The game looks and runs perfectly though.   It even keeps up with your game history.

I did have to hold on to change change position for the deck of cards to show up at the start.  Not sure if that was a bug.

Rating 9/10 Heck of a deal for sale price of $2.49 if you like Solitaire

author: {'steamid': '76561197970306406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1497365038}
review: Cool game! I hope that the devs will bring further updates. More options in the settings menu would be good: Better graphics (possibility to increase the pixel densitywith a graphics slider for example), possibility to adjust difficulty of the robots (AI-opponents are too fast for me as a beginner; I lose every game within some seconds). Please make this good game even better!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994002775', 'num_games_owned': 6538, 'num_reviews': 1438, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1689719105}
review:
Power Solitaire VR is a simple VR game that brings the classic card game of solitaire to life in a whole new way. 
Solitaire, being one of the oldest modern card games, has always been a beloved pastime. 
The single-player mode offers a captivating VR experience, mimicking the traditional gameplay we all know and love. 
Additionally, the multiplayer mode adds a new layer of enjoyment, allowing friends to challenge each other in a fun and competitive way.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nPuceZJFh_4

author: {'steamid': '76561198037452204', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1500972095}
review:
This adaptation of Solitaire for Vr is amazing! Wonderful design and it works perfect! Best part about it? It's 2$! Go find some loose change in the cushions of your couch if you want a cheap and super fun Vr experience. I recommend this game to anyone that gets any enjoyment out of non virtual reality solitaire. This will give you hours of fun in the future for sure.

Great Developers, Keep up the work!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974963042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1486220923}
review:
Fun way to play Solitaire on your expensive VR rig.

The gameplay mechanics are good, all the fun of playing with a real deck of cards, combined with the joy of not having to deal/shuffle them manually for each game.

Not great for prolonged game sessions though as the height-adjustable table requires that you spend a lot of time looking downwards to see the cards, straining through the weight of the headset (Vive) and the blurry edges of the lenses.

Would be great to see more varied environments and perhaps the choice of a custom/workshop-powered skybox?

Some improvements I'd suggest:

- allow the play table to angled in front of the user
- be more forgiving with throwing cards to the stacks at the top
- allow the deck to be repositioned so you don't have to stretch over the play area

author: {'steamid': '76561197989931461', 'num_games_owned': 3024, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1485987583}
review:
its... interesting. does what it says, i suppose... but really could use a bit more polish. for example, sound is either on or off, same for music. also, some of the interface elements are poorly placed, especially the 'return to menu' element, which is so far away i risk punching my monitor to hit it.

there really needs to be a way to move the table around AFTER you have started a game. i can recenter the view, but not move the table, or rather if i can, i cant figure out how to do it.

but, if you want to play solitaire in vr, this is the only game in town, and it does it reasonably well, so its hard to go wrong for two bucks.
